Bob’s Burgers || Aus Bob entspringt ein Fluss
programme.desc: Comedyserie. Zum Start der 4. Staffel macht Familie Belcher einen verhängnisvollen Campingtrip.Familienoberhaupt Bob kann es kaum erwarten, sich vollkommen von der Natur zu ernähren – und hat deshalb keine Lebensmittel eingepackt. Zum Glück campen nebenan ein paar Weltuntergangsfanatiker, die großzügig ihre Vorräte teilen. Doch als die Eltern heimlich nackt baden gehen, packt sie der reißende Fluss, und die drei Kinder müssen sich allein durch die gemeingefährliche Wildnis voller Eichhörnchen und Pfadfinder kämpfen… Mehrfach nominiert, gewann die Serie 2014 den Emmy als beste animierte Show. Kurios: Im Original werden sämtliche weiblichen Mitglieder der Belcher-Familie (außer der jüngsten Tochter) von Männern gesprochen.

programme.title: Chase the Case
programme.desc: Five new contestants face a series of challenges in order to steal their opponents case and win.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: The Eggheads team are made up of some of Britain's top quizzers. They face a team of challengers trying to beat the incumbents in order to win a cash prize. If the Eggheads beat the challengers, the cash prize is rolled over to subsequent episodes.

programme.title: Glorious Gardens from Above
programme.desc: The county of Yorkshire is the setting for Christine Walkden's balloon tour of Britain. At Scampston Hall she discovers two superstar garden designers and meets young gardener Nathan, who is just starting out. At York Gate Garden, Christine catches up with an old friend and discovers the Yorkshire man who was the father of aviation.

programme.title: Flipping Profit
programme.desc: Philip Serrell, Tony Wong and trendy upholsterer extraordinaire Micaela Sharp head to Stratford-upon-Avon where they have just one day to find any bargains they can get their mitts on.

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: The mystery buyers live in the trendy suburbs of Manchester, and for three years they have had a space on their living room wall that they haven't been able to fill. Now they have £1,000 to spend and three artists turning detective around their home.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Leading criminal barristers Jeremy Dein QC and Sasha Wass QC reinvestigate a case of matricide dating from the 1920s, in which a renowned fraudster went to the gallows accused of murdering his mother. Kent, 1929. On the evening of 23 October, in the coastal town of Margate, a distraught guest of the Hotel Metropole stormed downstairs into the lobby. That guest was Sydney Fox. He screamed that his mother's room was on fire, and begged for help.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: At the historic Blackpool Tower Circus, Paul Martin is joined by experts James Lewis and David Fletcher. Between them, the team pick out a selection of interesting antiques and collectibles to be sold at auction. James discovers a collection of watches that have been in the back of a wardrobe for years and David finds a pistol dating back to the Battle of Waterloo.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing: It Takes Two

programme.title: Live: FA WSL

programme.title: Mary Berry Cook & Share
programme.desc: Mary explores the historic Jurassic Coast, famous for fossils, beautiful coastal towns and delicious seafood. Mary can't wait to share the delights on offer and meet the people passionate about preserving and showcasing them.

programme.title: Nadiya's Everyday Baking
programme.desc: With the assistance of her daughter Maryam, Nadiya shares family bakes that are as fuss-free as they are delicious. First up, Nadiya and Maryam, a self-confessed `flapjack fanatic', share their ultimate recipe for this classic family favourite.

programme.title: How to With John Wilson
programme.desc: John has a furniture destroying cat, and so he explores the challenges of keeping an object in pristine condition.

programme.title: BBC Weather

programme.desc: John Simpson brings his expertise to bear on the most important stories. In discussion with the BBC's range of experts across the world, he uses their unique local knowledge to go beyond the headlines to get to the unspun truth about the world.

programme.title: Stolen: Catching the Art Thieves
programme.desc: In 1994, Munch's The Scream is ripped from a gallery wall in Oslo.The detectives leading the investigation describe a complex and dangerous investigation which exposes the lengths to which criminals will go to gain a get-out-of-jail card for murder.

programme.title: Blackpool's Dance Fever
programme.desc: Once a year, the best ballroom and Latin dancers from across the globe quickstep their way to Blackpool to take part in dancing's most prestigious competition, the British Open Championships. For nearly 100 years, it has been one of Britain's best kept secrets. Take a look at the behind-the-scenes story of the Latin and ballroom dance scene in Blackpool.

programme.title: All That Glitters: Britain's Next Jewellery Star
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan welcomes back the four semi-finalists as they return to the workshop to create beautiful pieces in the two penultimate challenges. They must impress the judges by designing and creating a bestselling set of asymmetric earrings, before making a pair of bespoke cufflinks for a special client who selflessly patrols Birmingham's streets to keep people safe.

programme.title: Martin Compston's Scottish Fling
programme.desc: Martin is given a taste of island life when pal Phil takes him on a journey to his family's homeland of the Western Isles. From an unexpected Hebridean pipe playing welcome at the airport in Stornoway, Martin and Phil embark on their island odyssey.

programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph is at Altrincham recycling centre in Greater Manchester, trying to unearth three hidden gems before they're lost forever. Carpenter Bruce Faulseit takes on an antique card table, while upholsterer Simion Hawtin-Smith has the challenge of overhauling a wicker chair. For her own project, Jacqui has a pair of clunky cabinets to rejuvenate.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Tim gambles on a few purchases, picking up a captain's chair, a pair of bears and a bronzed sculpture of a footballer. Margie makes time to find out about this little island's big contribution to democracy at the Tynwald Parliament.

programme.title: Fake or Fortune?
programme.desc: Fiona and Philip visit a church in Port Glasgow to investigate whether a mysterious work depicting Christ after the crucifixion could be a lost masterpiece by one of the great painters of Northern Renaissance art.

programme.title: Chase the Case
programme.desc: A strategy game show that trades general knowledge for intelligence. Five players begin the game with a case containing a secret amount of cash, and attempt to steal each other's cases, but only the player who gets over the line first will win.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: The Eggheads team are made up of some of Britain's top quizzers. They face a team of challengers trying to beat the incumbents in order to win a cash prize. If the Eggheads beat the challengers, the cash prize is rolled over to subsequent episodes.

programme.title: Glorious Gardens from Above
programme.desc: Christine Walkden takes to the skies above Sussex. She drops in at West Dean Garden to see the fruits of a 20-year labour of love and meets Laura, who found a new lease of life there. At Arundel Castle Gardens, she is astonished by the transformation of a former car park into a spectacular Italian garden.

programme.title: Flipping Profit
programme.desc: Fine art dealer Gavin Claxton, top trader Melissa Downhill and luxury upcycler Zoe Pocock head to Chipping Campden to find bargains they can flip into profit. The three experts have just one day to scour its flea markets and scrap yards.

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: The artists are heading to an art-loving home in Cheshire for an emotional brief. The mystery buyers would like a work of art to reflect a beloved dad who they lost in 2011. The creative three try to make them the perfect piece.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Prominent criminal barristers Sasha Wass QC and Jeremy Dein QC investigate an infamous Scottish murder case from 1862. A former domestic servant was sentenced to death for killing one of her friends, despite there being a compelling alternative suspect. Glasgow, 1862. On a summer's afternoon, members of the affluent Fleming family returned home from holiday to discover that their housemaid Jess McPherson was missing. They eventually unlocked her bedroom door to find her dead body.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul is joined by experts Elizabeth Talbot and Philip Serrell at Layer Marney Tower in rural Essex. Philip gets a visit from the police, Elizabeth comes across a mystery object, and Paul visits a stately home lived in by the SAS during WWII.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Eddie Kadi, Natasha Raskin Sharp, Charlie Stayt and Faye Tozer take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman.

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson uncovers the secrets of Cornwall's Tintagel, famed as the legendary birthplace of King Arthur. Ben discovers Tintagel was potentially more important than London a thousand years ago, based on recent evidence unearthed at an archaeological dig overseen by English Heritage. It was found that over 2,000 people were living here which, at the time, which would have made it the largest settlement anywhere of its kind in Britain.

programme.title: Iolo: A Wild Life
programme.desc: Iolo digs up footage from around towns and parks. In one of his first TV appearances, back in 1998, he was chasing lapwing chicks in Llandudno Junction. He also recalls filming kittiwakes nesting on Mumbles pier, and thousands of gulls raiding refuse bags on bin day in Cardiff.

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: In Eastbourne, new recruit Chris is put through his paces when two casualties are cut off by the tide near Beachy Head. On the coast of south Wales, Penarth crew member Tom is called up for his first ever shout when a female paddleboarder is caught out by the tide. In Fistral, north Cornwall, 22 year old lifeguard Kai races to the rescue of a young surfer who's in danger of being smashed on the rocks.

programme.title: All That Glitters: Britain's Next Jewellery Star
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan hosts as the remaining three jewellers compete in the grand final. They are challenged to create a sapphire engagement ring, before making a specially commissioned occasion necklace for `Strictly Come Dancing' judge Shirley Ballas.

programme.desc: The inimitable Larry Dean introduces comedians Harriet Kemsley and Slim to the stage.

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Clutching his 1899 copy of Appleton's Guide to Canada, Michael Portillo travels on the Ocean train from Nova Scotia to New Brunswick. Along the way he investigates the world's biggest tide at Hopewell Rocks and admires its dramatic rock formations and caves. He apparently defies gravity on a magnetic hill in a 1965 Pontiac Bonneville. North of Moncton in Miramichi, he joins the Elipogtog First Nation in a pow wow, where he learns about quilting and traditional dress.

programme.title: From Ice to Fire: The Incredible Science of Temperature
programme.desc: Dr Helen Czerski explores the narrow band of temperature that has led to life on Earth. She reveals how life began in a dramatic place where hot meets cold, and how every single living creature on Earth depends on temperature for its survival.

programme.title: Walter's War
programme.desc: In a drama inspired by the life of Walter Tull who, after years in an orphanage, went on to become a professional footballer, then the first black commissioned officer to lead British troops during World War I. The action concerns Tull's turbulent passage from ordinary soldier to extraordinary officer at officer training camp, where he had to face his own demons as well as fight the prejudice that surrounded him.
